definition: Qing government (1644-1911)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
political/politics/government
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)
Manchurian Qing government

sentences.english: But Rong Hong returned only to find a poverty-stricken country under a corrupt government.
sentences.chinese: 容闳回国后，看到了清政府的腐朽落后和国家的贫困。

sentences.english: Hulan is the earliest open region of Qin Dynasty in the northeast China.
sentences.chinese: 呼兰是清政府在东北最早开禁的地区。

sentences.english: Abstrac: The Cohong is the product of opening trade policy of Qing government.
sentences.chinese: 行商是清政府对外贸易政策的产物。

sentences.english: In Qing Dynasty Government, Li Hongzhang is the main leader and practitioner of the construction of coast defense.
sentences.chinese: 李鸿章是清政府海防建设的主要领导人和实践者。

sentences.english: The Qing government was conservative diehards against the reformers change.
sentences.chinese: 清政府顽固派却抱残守缺，反对维新变革。

sentences.english: In the first year of Yongzheng, Qing government set up the military exam of Mongolian eight-counties.
sentences.chinese: 雍正元年，清政府开设了八旗蒙古武举。

sentences.english: During Kangxi's reign in the Qing Dynasty, the government surveyed land throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 康熙年间，清政府对全国土地进行清查和丈量。

sentences.english: Discontent with the dynasty was rising among other groups, too. Some of this was economic.
sentences.chinese: 其它团体对清政府也不满，其中包括一些商业团体。

sentences.english: The Qing government ceded China's Hong Kong to Britain.
sentences.chinese: 清政府把中国的香港割让给英国。

sentences.english: We can not rely on the Qing government, but to rely on the masses of people.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能依靠清政府，而是要依靠人民大众。

sentences.english: Three markets are all open under Qing government proposition.
sentences.chinese: 三市都是在清政府提议下开设的。

sentences.english: As he didn't realize the tasks, the Qing government dismissed him from his post.
sentences.chinese: 由于他未能完成任务，清政府撤去其职。

sentences.english: And some persons advised the educational problems to the Qing government after they come back.
sentences.chinese: 还有部分人在回国后就教育问题向清政府进言。

sentences.english: The government 's foreign policy be savage .
sentences.chinese: 行商是清政府对外贸易政策的产物。

sentences.english: But the Qing faced one big and growing problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是，清政府仍然面临一个巨大且日益严重的问题。

definition: the Qing court (as government of China)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Great Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
the (great) Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)/Qing Empire
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
Boxer Protocol of 1901 signed in Beijing, ending the Eight-power Allied Force intervention after the Boxer uprising
the Great Powers (history)
Boxer Rebellion
Sino-French War (1883-1885) (concerning French seizure of Vietnam)
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
